website_summaries.verdict: This rugged cart lives up to its name, and offers handy, user-friendly features that make it well worth the price, which is surprisingly affordable considering the quality.
pros: You get a lot for your money with this cart, including a tough steel frame, patented dump release, padded handle, and 600-pound capacity
Easy to pull over different surfaces, including mud, rocks, gravel, and more
cons: Assembly can be challenging, as the instruction lack specific details
Rare quality control issues including flat tires upon delivery

customer_reviews.title: Strong, Multi-Purpose Wagon ... My 2nd One
customer_reviews.text: The wagon is strong and multi-purpose. The wheels make it easy to travel across any type landscape. One of my favorite features is the "dump"/tilt of the wagon bed. You can dump your load. However, I have found you can also roll/push a heavy load into the bed before righting it. This saves your back from having to lift the load into the wagon. This is my second wagon ... the last one I had lasted 9 years. Do yourself a favor and replace the hardware before putting your wagon together. (I took off a star for the hardware) Also, here's an arthritis tip, spray the screws/bolts with WD-40. It will make the hardware screw together much easier.
customer_reviews.author: stillwaters

customer_reviews.title: Not what I purchased.
customer_reviews.text: Instead of sending me the new Gorilla cart I paid for I received an open box. One of the wheels was broken and the tire flat. The axles were scratched and had been lubricated. Obviously a cart that had been used and then returned. Not new. Not as expected. Not good.
customer_reviews.author: M. Bicknell

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't know how this works because we couldn't finish putting ...
customer_reviews.text: Wouldn't know how this works because we couldn't finish putting it together. What a nightmare! All the nuts and bolts were tough to do without a second person and the last one wouldn't tighten at all. Not sure how to even return this thing. The thought of having to take it apart is less than appealing. Very disappointed in this product! We were really looking forward to replacing our beach wagon with this heavy duty model but we could never find a nut that would fit the factory bolt. I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: karen

customer_reviews.title: Delivered in a damaged box, came with a bad tire that had its valve stem bent nearly off
customer_reviews.text: Item came in a damaged box that was obviously previously opened and taped closed again - I began putting together this cart and when putting on the wheels noticed that one of the wheels had it valve stem bent beyond use and was not holding any air, now I have a cart with 3 good wheels and one bum wheel. Out of the box this thing has basically become useless for me. Not worth returning after I had already assembled the product completely. Shame on me for not checking the tire first things first. Now I'm stuck with a cart that only has 3 good wheels. Fortunately it can still be used for light purposes like leaves.
customer_reviews.author: C.T.

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money. Not built so great.
customer_reviews.text: Plastic bent already. Bolts don't stay in. Overall not too happy for the money
customer_reviews.author: gil moses

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely horrible to put together
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely horrible to put together.. wrestle the bin.. nuts don't screw on easily.. still in pieces until I have a second person around to hold the bolts
customer_reviews.author: Theresa O'Neill

customer_reviews.title: Not stable.
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited to order this garden cart. Today, I finally decided to put it together. The screws were to loose. Took it apart many times to make sure I was doing it correct. I put the cart all together and the parts were not lined up. Returned it. 😞
customer_reviews.author: Athene

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to use as a garden wagon and decided on this model because it presented as very tough. Its not. It arrived damaged, the front end of cart piece bent inward, with sharp edge stuck out. The welded bolt that connects cart to frame was not welded on evenly and not all the way around. I had thrown away the box from the wagon and the shipping box several days before putting the wagon together. If I hadnt I would have returned the wagon. How tough can it be if it arrives with the front of cart damaged like that. Would never recommend.
customer_reviews.author: kared

customer_reviews.title: Aggravation to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Aggravated! This is ridiculous that this literally is how far the bolt will screw on. There is some plastic insert in the bolt part and that is far as the screw can screw on. This is incredibly frustrating. Also the plastic container itself is not great....not incredibly strong....think like mop bucket strength. Okay for hauling some flowers and a little dirt but this will fail over the course of time if you haul rocks or even mulch. And it stinks so bad you need to assemble it outside or you might die from the chemicals. It’s that bad.
customer_reviews.author: A. Penguin

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: Would give it a 0 if I could. Hardware is cheap and nuts and bolts will not fully tighten . pretty pointless to attempt to haul any weight since you cannot fasten anything tight enough to secure without bolts crossthreading and stripping. The trick here will be removing the parts I have assembled to fit back in the box to return it. Customer service number rings without answering so no hope there. This will be my last purchase ever through this vendor as life is too short for this aggravation.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer1

customer_reviews.title: Warning — you need extra tools to assemble this!
customer_reviews.text: I don’t get the folks who say this is easy to assemble. The instructions show the tools you need, and do not include a socket wrench. I found it impossible to tighten the nuts without one (which I had to buy after I started). The nuts have a plastic ring inside which should help them to stay tight, but they also require a considerable amount of torque to push the bolt though the plastic ring. With a socket wrench and a large flat head screw driver, assembly is possible. I cannot understand how anyone could do it with only the tools listed on the directions.
customer_reviews.author: Belinda

customer_reviews.title: Nope. Don't recommend for garden use.
customer_reviews.text: Well it's a nice little cart to have but the soft style tires and slightly flimsy sides are no good at all. If you use this in the yard these wheels are just not right at all, second time around now I've had to get the tyres fixed as they always get punctured!!! Not good enough for a garden cart at this price point it's not cheap at all Needs to have the hard wheels and not these cheap puncturable tyres so I would say unless you're planning to keep this on pathways and driveways stay away from it as there is nothing "gorillarized" about it it's pretty flimsy for what you might expect it to be capable of doing!
customer_reviews.author: Pinkstar

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I'm 65 now and my early morning (3 AM) routine of volunteering... of cleaning the downtown streets of litter and emptying the sidewalk trashcans was getting more than I could physically handle in carrying several bags 3 to four blocks. So my wife purchased this little cart for my to be able to continue to collect, sort recyclables and carry the bags on it instead of by hand. It's a tough little fella...
customer_reviews.author: John R Middleswarth

customer_reviews.title: Assembly nightmare
customer_reviews.text: The nuts and bolts are impossible to screw together. Why not just include normal nuts and bolts with lock washers?! Plus there are several places where you don't even have enough room to use a wrench to turn the nut. How on earth are you supposed to turn a nut with a wrench when you can't even get the wrench onto the nut? And holding the bolts in place with a screwdriver while trying to turn the other nuts is literally impossible. The bolts need to be held with a wrench when that must force is needed to hold them in place. I would never recommend this to anyone. DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY OR YOUR TIME.
customer_reviews.author: MaggiePie

customer_reviews.title: Great Work Cart!
customer_reviews.text: Arrived today and I put it together in under an hour. Easy to follow instructions and the shrink wrapped card with the nuts and bolts made sure you had the right hardware fifth the right step. The components look to be very well made. Can't wait to get it out in the backyard to do some landscaping work. Took it out for a test drive, very easy to move around.
customer_reviews.author: J. Auchenbach

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely crappy assembly
customer_reviews.text: I have survived much worse and harder assembly instructions than this but let me tell you, the time and effort it took to screw everything in made me scream in fury on my kitchen floor. I feel like there are so many areas the manufacturer could have begun the assembly for the buyer. Instead, I had to go find my tools and attempt to stabilize the nut while I was reaching AROUND the wagon and screwing the bolt. It was a HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: some tips on assembly
customer_reviews.text: You can assemble with the tools they recommend but here are some tips. The square holes will need to cleaning out because some of the plastic didn't get cut out completely during manufacturing. Clean it out with a box cutter and the carriage bolts will go into the hole easier. The bolts, washers, and nut come packaged in the order they should be assembled. The big washer goes on the bolt side. The smaller washer goes on the nut side. Use a 1/2" socket to tighten the nuts. Either use a ratchet or a drill with appropriate attachment.
customer_reviews.author: Microgrl

customer_reviews.title: Opened the box and a tire has damage!!!
customer_reviews.text: Just received mine about 10 minutes ago and it came with a damage in one tire. I really needed this for the weekend. Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Karyn

customer_reviews.title: Clever design.. dumps easily. Pathetic, very thin weak plastic bed.
customer_reviews.text: Good highly functional wagon. The dump feature is much more amazing than expected. You have to try it to know how easy it is to dump even the heaviest loads. The rear two wheels instantly shift forward and the bed dumps over with relatively little force. One disappointment-- Plastic bed way too thin, weak and soft. A "GORILLA" wagon deserves a far more robust bed. This thin wimpy bendy plastic bed is pathetic... Looks like it will crack eventually. The molding lacks good wall thickness, ribs, reinforcement in the front where it dumps and hits the ground. And in lower corners where stress concentrates. With some design Improvements, excellence is close at hand for this clever product.
customer_reviews.author: RickWAllen

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing customer service - item defective
customer_reviews.text: Love the cart but it came with one tire deflated (in fact it had a hole in the inner tube). I submitted a claim on the gorillacarts.com website 5 days ago and haven't heard a thing despite the automated response "A customer service representative will contact you to finalize your claim". They should have better quality control.
customer_reviews.author: TGL

customer_reviews.title: Great for my purposes.
customer_reviews.text: Not hard to assemble but a little awkward for me (70-year-old woman). The body of the wagon is not as sturdy as I had hoped, but it will haul as much as I can pull and then some. So far, I have transported 160 8-pound pavers (18 at a time) and 16 50-pound bags of pea gravel (2 at a time) across my lawn to the area where they were needed. A stronger person could easily transport more at a time. Rolls great through grass. Easier for me to maneuver than a wheelbarrow. Dump feature is also a plus, but for me, have to load back end so as not to make it too heavy to lift the dump handle.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It is GREEN!! Yay...
customer_reviews.text: First, I hate putting anything together but I needed a garden cart at my new house so I could not wait until spring to buy one in the store already put together >so, I checked Amazon and by golly, there one was AND IN GREEN, my favorite color,......having said all this, it arrived today (Prime, yay!). I immediately took it from its box, laid out all the parts; got the tools from the garage (thankfully, I had them all) and put it together in 30 minutes...it was the easiest thing I have ever assembled! I am extremely happy with this purchase...
customer_reviews.author: K-9 Lover

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and A Great Value for the Price
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Gorilla Cart. These are such great carts that left unattended my first cart was stolen! 🤷‍♀️ The cart is sturdy and is big enough for bags of soil, plants and tools. I grow tomatoes 🍅 so I need a cart with room for tools and fertilizer. I quit growing herbs. My sons called my herb garden “Death Row.” The easy dumping is the feature that sold me on this model. The easy stirring prevents tip overs. Sturdy and a great value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Proud Geek Mom

customer_reviews.title: Great gardening tool, does not replace a wheelbarrow
customer_reviews.text: I read many reviews complaining about difficulty with assembly. I purchased the item anyway. I found that the assembly was extremely easy. Completed assembly in about 10 minutes. We have used this for general gardening and household chores. It works very well for general hauling and I prefer it to a wheelbarrow for most cases. I will say, if I need to move a yard of dirt I would pick a wheelbarrow hands down. (It does not replace a wheelbarrow completely) I do use this more than a wheelbarrow though so I am pleased with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: paul

customer_reviews.title: No Substitute
customer_reviews.text: it's like a member of the family I bought one 8yrs ago when Son#2 was born instead of a wimpy-a$$ radio Flyer. the original Gorilla Cart was used on a near-daily basis for long walks, was taken all over the country in the back of a van for camping/hiking trips, floated in lakes, drug through sand on South padre. After 8yrs of use & abuse the poor thing was starting to fall apart (the old style parallelogram front steering was done). The new one may be better. it has simpler, more robust steering mechanism and a better handle. Nice painted, ball-bearing wheels. Tough, light, versatile. Highly recommended!!
customer_reviews.author: Alex Croy

customer_reviews.title: It was easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: Firstly, it was easy to put together. It does take 2 people though. One person to hold the screw so it wont move (by using a phillips head screwdriver) and one person to screw the nut tight (using a socket wrench). You will need 2 sizes of socket wrenches or an adjustable one (or a plain old wrench will work). Each set of instructions was clear and most importantly, the nuts and bolts needed for each step were clearly marked and separated by number. No more searching for the right screws! The cart is very sturdy and the wheels maneuver smoothly. It is easy to pull and dump. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: MFP

customer_reviews.title: Terrific!
customer_reviews.text: This is a terrific cart! Its a great size and moves really well. The tires are able to maneuver well over various terrains. It holds a fair amount without impacting on its ability to move. Great for all my gardening needs. My only critique would be if they could add a locking mechanism on the wheels for when you're working with a slope and also one on the handle so it could stay upright if you so wished.
customer_reviews.author: Elle

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs!
customer_reviews.text: My previous cart broke after 5 yrs (fold down seat) so I can’t complain although insufficient for my current needs. This cart is awesome so far! Easy to assemble and ready to go. I immediately used it for storm damage branches and yard refuse and finished carting my yard bags to the curb. Took it in back, rinsed it off using the dump which works nicely. Again, it’s early and durability is huge but so far, I can see this as a valuable piece in my gardening endeavors. In the picture, there were many more branches when I started yesterday. Will update as needed!
customer_reviews.author: Richard Shelton

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Design - Functions Perfectly - Very Easy to Assemble
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Design - Functions Perfectly - Very Easy to Assemble This durable wagon has replaced my old wheelbarrow. I will never look back. The steering radius is tight, the load capacity is perfect, the dumping mechanism is brilliant, and it rolls easily through the sand on the beach. I almost didn't purchase because of reviews stating it was hard to assemble. These reviews should be removed because they are very misleading. Easy to follow instructions with very nice hardware card. I highly recommend you add this wagon to your garage or shed.
customer_reviews.author: JNelsonCo

customer_reviews.title: Great all around utility cart
customer_reviews.text: Guys! It’s really a great cart. It takes a little time to put together but don’t believe the haters that say things don’t line up right or the wheels don’t stay on or any of that nonsense. People, if you don’t know, it’s ok, it really is. You can’t know everything. I mean, come on, how fun would life be if you knew it all? Plus most people would hate you anyway. No one likes a know-it-all, but you have to bend the cotter pins on the wheels to create some tension on them after you put them through the hole. Needle nose plyers work well. That’s all I got.
customer_reviews.author: johng

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, easy to assemble by this senior. Very handy for many things!
customer_reviews.text: To start assembly, my husband helped. Soon, he got tired, so I finished in less time it was taking the two of us. It was really helpful all the nuts and bolts were the same size. The hex style bolts made it easy, once I figured out all you had to do was to push the into the fitting - hole the cart. Once together, very maneuverable. Am hoping to use it on the beach, as the beach cart I got here, years ago, is very difficult to pull on the sand due to thinner wheels. Might think I will tweak this up with drink holders.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth S. Wood

customer_reviews.title: Challenging to Assemble
customer_reviews.text: It was challenging to attach the metal components and frame to the plastic tub. Assembly suggestions in the review posted by Bill (dated 5/19/16) were helpful and cost just $5.81 at Home Depot. Even then assembly was a two-person job due to the shape of the cart and the location of the bolts. While we saved some money by purchasing this on Amazon, we would not buy a product of this nature online in the future. We feel we would be better served to use our money to support local small businesses, pay local workers to help with assembly tasks, and have local stores available to help with product problems.
customer_reviews.author: Doodle

customer_reviews.title: Buy the larger version. It’s a better value.
customer_reviews.text: If you’re looking at purchasing this for a child or for an elderly that will perform light work then this is sufficient. I bought the larger version first which is amazing in comparison to this smaller one. If you’re looking to purchase this you may want to spend the extra money to get the larger as it’s a much better value.. I have filled the larger so many times with easily 500lbs of stone and it handles it with no problem and the tipping feature is much nicer on the larger as well. I would not buy this smaller version again. It is now used by a seven year old which it has made a great companion for her imagination...
customer_reviews.author: Joe Schmo

customer_reviews.title: Gorilla cart
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this to help me around yard and house. I absolutely love it. The bed of it seems a little flimsy. But, it’s actually flexible and very tough. All four tires have tubes in them. Three of which hold air great. The third not at all. It’s most likely is the valve stem. I wouldn’t want to put hundreds of pounds in the wagon. Some mulch or a few bags of groceries is about all I would put in it. I will update my review once I get another tire/tube. Great little cart for hauling small things. Seems easy to use dump features. I’m also going to inquire about another tire.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: The bucket feels like a sweater box.
customer_reviews.text: The unit is not particularly heavy, but when you pick it up by the bed, the back just crinkles in your hand. That’s empty. I was disappointed putting it together to find at the plastic in the bed of the wagon scarcely as thick as a Rubbermaid sweater box. Fortunately the plastic is far from brittle, so I would imagine that as you flatten it with the handle of a shovel, or if you miss the bed and hit it with a block, and a crumples, that it will mostly pop back into shape. I don’t figure on this unit lasting more than a summer or two.
customer_reviews.author: DrJohnsonCom

customer_reviews.title: Tougher than it looks...
customer_reviews.text: Had this wagon for a year, and have used it to haul leaves, grass, tools, dirt, plants - but it really earned its keep this week. I had to relocate some river rocks in my landscaping- and this wagon was the bomb. I loaded it full and towed it up and down a dirt hill with the rocks - and it did the job beautifully. Easy to move, went very "off road" and I pulled it up and down a pretty steep dirt hill with confidence. If you need a little workhorse that works as hard as you do, this will fit the bill. The dump feature is amazing, too btw.
customer_reviews.author: Liv'in Learn

customer_reviews.title: Insane Assembly
customer_reviews.text: So, this was NOT easy to assemble. It took two people, and the tools recommended by the instructions are NOT the same as the list of tools another reviewer on here recommended. Whoever wrote the instructions probably needs to do some step-by-step testing with a better set of tools and revise them. But after it's assembled, it's pretty nice.
customer_reviews.author: Faluna

customer_reviews.title: No Assembly Instructions
customer_reviews.text: Negative- No assembly instructions included, but you can find a complete video on YouTube. There are a few key points that need instruction, like which way to face the bolts for the best functionality. Also, the handle is too short for me. I am 6’ tall and have to slouch to pull the cart, which is difficult for large loads or long distances. There is no extension, so I just use a piece of rope. Positive- Sturdy, highly maneuverable. Great turning radius and the tires arrived completely inflated. It took about 30min to assemble and I was hauling dirt right away.
customer_reviews.author: Connor B

customer_reviews.title: Not quite what I expected
customer_reviews.text: I have come to expect a bit more from Gorilla. I bought this without much hesitation because it's a Gorilla. I just received it and assembled, so we'll see once I started using it, but it seems to be just a step up from something I could have gotten from HF. The frame seems sturdy enough, but extremely basic... again, not what I'm sed to seeing in a Gorilla product... but mostly, the tub is much flimsier than I expected. I'm sure it will hold up ok, but not gonna take much of a beating with out cracking at some point.
customer_reviews.author: the Gringo

customer_reviews.title: Very durable, useful cart
customer_reviews.text: I almost didn't buy this because of some of the reviews, but my neighbor let me borrow hers and I really liked it. The assembly instructions were so easy to follow. Even the hardware was numbered according to the step at which it was needed. I put it together myself in just under an hour. It would have gone faster with some help holding pieces in place. See my image of the directions for the tools you will need. So far I've just used mine to move bags of mulch and dirt. It moves easily through the grass. I have tested the dump feature and it works great. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better than a wheelbarrow!  Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: Good sized bed. Love the dump feature. All parts and instructions for putting it together were complete and understandable. Everything functioned perfectly after putting it together. 3 of the tires were flat but inflated easily. Hauled gravel (3/4 full) with no problem. LOVE the four wheel integration. No balance point needed when hauling, like with a wheelbarrow. This will be used for much more than a garden cart... Ex: hauling all the shopping bags from the car in the detached garage to the back door, bringing in heavy deliveries from the gate 200' away, etc. And, (just for fun), giving the dog a ride around! Glad I chose this instead of a wheelbarrow. Much more functional for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: NorCalGal

customer_reviews.title: so far so good
customer_reviews.text: I like that the wagon part is non-rusting plastic but also worry that it might be flimsy when filled with the advertised 600 lbs of debris. But all the metal dumping mechanism, the wheel axles, handle, are all very sturdy. Love that the tires are fully inflated and ready to go. Took about an hour to assemble. I used a socket wrench on the locking nuts because no way did I have the hand strength to crank those things down with a wrench and screwdriver. (1⁄2" socket fit perfectly). Now to start using it in the field!
customer_reviews.author: corgi lover

customer_reviews.title: Good wagon.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good wagon. Sturdy, stable, well designed. It took me 26 minutes to assemble it, this morning. I think it'd have only taken 20, but I was also watching the NASA channel's Dragon/International Space Station docking. :) Thankfully, the wagon instructions didn't use words--ah HEM! They only used pictures. And all the nuts and bolts were arranged on a sheet of paper, each step separately wrapped there. I just looked at a picture, unwrapped the bolts for that step, did it...next. The wagon looks great.
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: I am amazed at the weight this will hold
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife to garden with and she loves it. Recently we built a privacy fence, and I used it to haul bags of concrete. I am amazed at the weight this will hold. The pneumatic tires are great for going 'off-road' in the yard, and the dump bed is very handy. I'm very pleased with this purchase. One thing to note upon removing it from the box, the tires are covered in something slimy and they absolutely stink. Due to the heat, I decided to assemble this inside my house. I could not believe the smell. I keep it in the garage, and the smell subsided after a few days, but just wanted to mention that.
customer_reviews.author: Shreksbrother

customer_reviews.title: Instructions are awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I love the instructions -- all pictures, no words! screws are packaged individually, so almost no chance of missing a screw. Cart is fairly easy to assemble, but one does need a good crescent wrench set and a BIG screwdriver, the screws are the biggest I've seen. Took me an hour to put together, would have taken husband half that long, but I didn't want to wait for him to come home. Cart works nicely when finished, rubber wheels already pumped and ready to go. Cart not too heavy to lift. Happy.
customer_reviews.author: Puppy's Mama

customer_reviews.title: Too hard for an older person to put together alone, but the wagon is Great once assembled.
customer_reviews.text: Almost impossible for an older single woman to put together. You need two people. Instructions are not detailed. Thewagon might be great, but I can’t put it together , so may have to return it or pay someone to do it. I wouldn’t recommend getting this unless you have someone to help with assembly. Update...a friend with a rachett and socket set put it together in thirty min. Forget the tools they show ...they don t work well. Now that it’s together It’s great, but because of the poor and misleading instructions I initially gave it a four, but the wagon is great once together so it’s a five for quality and price.
customer_reviews.author: margo

customer_reviews.title: We love it. Awesome quality..
customer_reviews.text: This thing ROCKS. We have put ours through the ringer and it's a tank. We blew a tire day 2.. BUT we were on our way to harbor freight so we got a bottle of fix a flat (slime or whatever) filled the flat tire, used the compressor to air it up and we are back in business. Still holding strong.. It was a bummer getting the blow out but harbor freight sells suitable replacements for 9.00 bucks! (I got one just in case) We love this and it beats a wheel barrel in terms of practicality. We probably towed 5k lbs of materials and landscaping debris etc with this thing and it works good as new. Very good quality.
customer_reviews.author: SP

customer_reviews.title: Great cart!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great utility cart!! I use it to carry water to my ducks in the winter. I can't use a hose because the hoses freeze in the winter so I use the cart to carry x2, 5 gal buckets of water and I fill the cart with water also at the same time. It works great!! The cart can handle the weight of both 5 gal buckets full of water as well as the cart full at the same time. It does great with all this weight in the deep snow. I attached a video where the ducks are drinking the water as it overflows the bucket and cart hehehe.
customer_reviews.author: The Tunisons

customer_reviews.title: Super Easy Assembly. Worth the Money
customer_reviews.text: Nothing could have been easier to assemble. The only thing that would have made it easier is if a toymaker elf came with the cart and did the assembly for me. All the parts were there, as well as a list of tools I will need. I always prefer sockets over adjustable wrenches so if the list of tools specified socket size it would have helped a little but it's not a big deal. All the parts fit perfectly together. From start to finish, including the unboxing, verifying contents, gathering of tools, complete assembly, and cleanup took all of 26 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Dewitt

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for me
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice little cart. It's pretty sturdy and easy to move around. It's a little small, but I chose to get the small one so that's on me. One awesome thing about this cart is how easy it is to put together. I used 3 or 4 tools. A needlenose, 1/2 inch socket, 9/16 (I think) socket, and a an adjustable wrench. If you have a 1 inch socket I think you can forget the adjustable wrench, and the only thing I used the needlenose for was to bend the pins that hold on the wheels.
customer_reviews.author: afd33

customer_reviews.title: WOW never had this before!
customer_reviews.text: WOW! First time it was simple to match the parts to the assembly step. Instead of trying to match different sized nuts to Different length bolts to different washer sizes, typical for most stuff requiring assembly, Step 1 parts are all in one place on the ‘step 1’ cardboard backed parts- bolts nuts and washers already matched! Big time saver and avoids frustrating screw ups with mismatched parts. Only recommendation: goes together in one third the time with a half inch socket and drill. Did the whole thing myself this way without a problem. Great buy!!
customer_reviews.author: Mark the Marketer

customer_reviews.title: For the money it doesnt get any better.
customer_reviews.text: I cant say much about the longevity of this product as I have just put it together but I can see that this is a great product that will last a long time. Not only was the assembly very easy but I have to point out something that I dont see very often. All of the hardware is separated by each step so there is no guessing or hunting for which bolts or washers to use.
customer_reviews.author: Daran Van Koevering

customer_reviews.title: turns too far and tips over easily. It's plastic
customer_reviews.text: Previous reviewers have commented on the difficulty of single-handed assembly. It's true. It's tricky, but it can be done. Takes about an hour. My major complaint is that the front end is unstable, turns too far and tips over easily. It's plastic, that's true ---- but the parts that need to be metal are metal, and that's fine. It is a sturdy little dump-truck like wagon, that needs a brake of some kind, keeping it from more than 90 degree turns. I assembled it today, used it to move about 600 pounds of pebbles and found it to be a great tool, that would have gotten 5 stars if steering it wasn't so compromised.
customer_reviews.author: Book Lover Extraordinaire

customer_reviews.title: If a tornado snatched it, I'd buy another right away.
customer_reviews.text: This has been an excellent purchase. It's tough and travels well. For camping, it's a spare catch all or hauler. At the beach, it is perfect for the chairs, toys, and cooler. It also acts as a table for us grown ups. For a neighborhood bbq, this is the cooler that works the best. In our little patio, it stands on end in a corner until the next adventure. During the summer, we leave it in the back of the truck most of the time with the beach gear ready to go.
customer_reviews.author: Emily K. Purvis

customer_reviews.title: Great value !!
customer_reviews.text: This has to be the best, most versatile cart I've seen and especially value. It does everything I've used it for, haul things around the yard or house, load it with groceries to bring in from car instead of many trips (bad back) I researched utility carts for a few months before I decided on the Gorilla Cart, cost, durability, versatility, move ability, capacity. Hands down the best utility cart, I have the small model which is perfect for me. It has pneumatic tires that makes it easier to pull and roll over things, however I would recommend putting some Slime in the tubes before you air them up after assembly, depending on how you use it.
customer_reviews.author: Joe R.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: So far I love this cart. I've used it for hauling leaves, pine needles, dirt, and stones. It dumps easy, makes tight turns, and seems very strong. Of course, since the stones are very heavy, I only loaded about half full and didn't use the dumping feature until I mostly emptied it by hand. I heaped as full as possible with heavy, moist soil and used the dump feature just fine for that. The dumping part is locked in place until you pull the handle out to release and dump.
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I have been shopping around for a wheelbarrow/garden wagon for a while now and spotted this. So far, it’s perfect for our recent backyard clean-up day. It was a trooper. I give this 4 stars for “Easy to Assemble” only because it’s much easier with two people.
customer_reviews.author: Siren

customer_reviews.title: The assembly instructions and parts organization are the best I've seen in any self-assembly product
customer_reviews.text: A very high quality, heavy duty cart. The assembly instructions and parts organization are the best I've seen in any self-assembly product. We carry bags of fertilizer, sand, rocks, tools, etc. across even and uneven surfaces including gravel. The articulating, steerable front wheels make it easy to move around. We previously used only the Ames lawn cart shown in the picture. It's good for light weight bulky stuff like weeds, leaves, debris, etc. on flat surfaces, but not for heavy items as it become top heavy and unstable, particularly on uneven or gravel surfaces. We broke a wheel moving a landscape rock (Ames sent a replacement at no charge). The 2 carts complement each other pretty well.
customer_reviews.author: Doug J

customer_reviews.title: Great cart...poor shipping package
customer_reviews.text: The heavy cart package was delivered by postman and when opened the cart had been dropped on edge , shifted and broke the top plastic pan. The solution would have been to block the cart in the carton using heavy duty foam or corrugated inserts to prevent shifting. The replacement cart was received damaged to the plastic pan in the same edge just like the original one was damaged. There is obviously a design issue with the cart/packaging..
customer_reviews.author: Nana A

customer_reviews.title: Very nice!
customer_reviews.text: I design consumer products just like this for a living. This one is well thought out. I really liked that the hardware was “slightly” pre-assembled, and numbered by where you are in the instructions. The tires are inflated out of the box. I thought it might be hard to dump the bed, thought it might be too heavy, but not to bad. Took me 30-40 minutes to assemble by myself. It’s a small job wagon, but probably good for 90% of the jobs I’ll use it for.
customer_reviews.author: Jay C.

customer_reviews.title: Best garden wagon ever!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love my gorilla cart. After struggling with a child's plastic wagon I finally bought this really usefully Gorilla dump cart wagon. The assembly was made super easy by the parts being separated and numbered for each step. And, there was no way anything could be lost in shipment or used in the wrong place. Using it is wonderful! It makes sharp turns easily without tipping and holds more than I can pull across flat ground. The dump feature is so handy for moving soil and gravel. It dumps securely and empties easily. This is my new best friend in the garden and for hauling almost everything. .
customer_reviews.author: Okmunky

customer_reviews.title: Tough little wagon
customer_reviews.text: I bought this instead of a wheelbarrow for my community garden. I'll never buy another wheelbarrow again. This holds everything I can load on it, the dump feature is perfect. And I can use it for much more, hauling supplies, groceries, even a large load of mulch I picked up. I don't really recommend piling it like this, but it moved it 2 blocks without spilling. Be careful with the bed, it's flexible and can easily crack, I already have a small one after a month. I also added an extra washer to each wheel tighten them up. I didn't like the wiggle in the wheels.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Love my "Gorilla"
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Gorilla Cart, identical to the one I purchased about 6 years ago. The tires on the old one dry-rotted and it was almost as cheap to buy a new cart as it would have been to buy new tires. The hardware card and assembly instructions are very clear and I was able to put the cart together in short order. Since this 80 year old uses the cart as a wheel barrow it has become an essential item to use and to move items around the garden.
customer_reviews.author: B.D.

customer_reviews.title: Handy mama's helper
customer_reviews.text: For now, this little buggy will be used to clean out rooms and buildings at wife's parents' house. Easy to assemble-I'd recommended adding a socket to the tools suggested in instructions. And be sure to do what I didn't - check dimensions of tub. I already have a similar version of this, only the tub is much larger. And I pulled one star because of packaging. Ours was delivered by a rural usps service. The outer box used to ship this cart was oversized, with lots of airspace and a strip of paper for "padding". Best part was the single piece of tape used to hold box shut. Not sturdy at all.
customer_reviews.author: Handycandyman

customer_reviews.title: Great for moving soils and rocks around the garden.
customer_reviews.text: Had it for a few weeks. Very helpful in moving soil, gravel and rocks around the yard. Tires pump up by regular bicycle pump, the Schrader valve (not the skinny Presta). Keeping them inflated and even makes a big difference. Assembly is fine, screwdriver and two wrenches. Dumping feature is excellent! Definitely easier than a wheelbarrow, but a different tool. It states 600 lbs which us very heavy. I filled it up with gravel and rocks and found it easy to move around.
customer_reviews.author: OT

customer_reviews.title: Gorilla poly garden cart
customer_reviews.text: I'm 65 years old and put this together myself. It would have been easier with another person but could still do it myself. Very easy to pull around and use the dump. You can even attach it to another vehicle to pull around. We get very high winds on the mountain so it will be easy to pick up sticks, etc after a very windy day. Better than a one wheel, wheel barrow. With the four wheels on this one it makes it steadier.
customer_reviews.author: Marie Louise Grazulis

customer_reviews.title: Recommend 2 for assembly,  but great instructions and packaging.
customer_reviews.text: Liked: the instructions and method of packaging all the hardware was very well thought out! Recommend 2 people for the assembly, as it was much easier than reaching around, trying to steady everything while using the torque wrench (not included, but use if you have one!) Didn't like? Not much. The cart plastic could be a bit firmer/thicker, but perhaps a bit of play helps the longevity.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Dual use!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for more than one use. In the yard, obviously....but as water toy for my granddaughter! After my husband put this together I noticed the screws on the bottom, which wouldn't hold water....that's what caulking is for. Holds water now! She has so much fun filling it up with water and playing with her water toys! And, for carting her around too! I love multi-use things!!!
customer_reviews.author: T.  Lee

customer_reviews.title: Much easier than a wheel burrow!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this cart, super easy to use, has a dumping mechanism that allows you to just dump whatever you’re pulling. I bought it because I can’t maneuver a wheel burrow, I needed something that I can transfer mulch throughout my garden. You can use this cart for anything! That’s why I like it so much. If you struggle with a wheel barrow, then this is your new tool. Totally worth the money. My boyfriend put it together, the only complaint he had was the smell of the plastic was intense. He left it outside for a day unwrapped to release some of the smell.
customer_reviews.author: Abbie

customer_reviews.title: Plastic Cart...
customer_reviews.text: Metal frame and tires seem like they are sturdy and will last but plastic cart is thin and feels flimsy and it bends easy...you will not be able to throw heavy rocks or anything of significant weight in the cart without damaging it despite the 600 lb weight limit. While putting it together it got a bunch of scratches from laying on the concrete and from the tools. Also bolts are extremely difficult to put on because of a plastic piece at the end that makes putting this thing together a real pain. Overall not impressed but it will work for light gardening.
customer_reviews.author: Tanya Smith

customer_reviews.title: Was looking for a little red wagon for grandson
customer_reviews.text: but ran across this wagon. It is WELL made for the money and I expect it will outlast all of us! No it's not the iconic wagon most of us grew up using, but it is TOUGH and I expect will work not only for his play but also for barn use in the stable for me when he isn't here. A quick scrub and rinse and back to play time!
customer_reviews.author: TGilliland

customer_reviews.title: I love my wagon!
customer_reviews.text: I drag this cart with me all over the place, use it when I unload the jeep after shopping to cut down back and forth trips, use it for gardening, I even use it to take the garbage down the down the road for pick up. It's very sturdy, easy to put together, and the uses are endless. I'm so happy I got this cart. I have others, but for my height and weight one was too big to be comfortable for me, and the other was too flimsy for my needs. This one is just perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Betti726

customer_reviews.title: Easy to pull when loaded and not go heavy.
customer_reviews.text: Due to my RA and hand pain, I now need assistance in getting heavy bags up the driveway. This cart helps so much, plus in cold/icy weather I can get the job done quicker. It is easy to handle and real sturdy. When my husband put it together, he noted that the layout and organization of the parts and instructions were the neatest he had ever seen and that by following them "a monkey could put this together." That's high praise. By using this light and easy to move cart, daily chores are a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: Mish

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Little Cart
customer_reviews.text: I am nearly ashamed to say how much my wife and I have abused this cart. Normally I take really good care of my possessions, but I bought this card a little over a year ago to haul dirt and clay adding window wells to our basement for egress windows. I loaded hundreds of pounds of load after, let and muddy clay, I ran it into limbs, tipped it all over, and it just stood up so well. My wife has left it in the rain for extended periods of time, and it is still going great. I am truly impressed and rarely write reviews but this Gorilla cart has amazed me with its quality.
customer_reviews.author: T. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Gorilla dump cart.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together. Hauls a lot of weight and with the big tires is easy to pull over rough and uneven terrain. The dump option is a great add on that really help to save your back. Glad I got this Cart. As others have noted, the tires do have an obnoxious smell out of the box. However, after letting it sit outside over night, that smell have gone away. Great item and will buy again if I ever wear it out.
customer_reviews.author: EJR

customer_reviews.title: Assembly sucks but worth it
customer_reviews.text: Took 2 adults and a child plus over an hour to get this thing out together. Assembly was beyond a pain. But once put together, its great. Easy to handle. Rolls over grass, concrete, gravel with ease. Holds plenty of weight for my needs. Dump feature is easy to use. Love this wagon. Hated putting it together. Ship it already assembled. Docking a star because of it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Buyer

customer_reviews.title: A great wagon! Easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.text: This was super easy to assemble. The instructions were very good, clearly illustrated and numbered steps with the bolts also packaged with correlating numbers. My 5yr. old grandson and I, grandma, put it together in about 30 minutes. Then proceeded to haul a huge pile of brush, the dumping ability is really handy and easy to use. I highly recommend this wagon for all your yard chores.
customer_reviews.author: tigerlily

customer_reviews.title: Damaged tub
customer_reviews.text: Opened the box and found a damaged tub. The box was not damaged at at, so I believe the put it in the box this way. Called manufacturer and left voice mail and also went to their website and filled out a claim. Waiting on the manufacturer for a response. If not response in a few days, then I will returning for a refund. Update. I was contacted by the manufacturer and sent a new tub. It arrived in good condition. I assembled the cart and it is perfect. Assembly was easy, parts went together well, and the assembly directions are easy to follow. Overall, I am very pleased. I am changing my rating to 4 stars. Great customer service.
customer_reviews.author: John Chadwick

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: hard to tightened the bolts. easier with 2 people. but doable for 1 person to build. Update 8/29/18: from 5 stars to 3 stars —— first time I added some real weight in this cart that its supposed to handle and it’s got a flat tire. Can’t contact anyone. Advise; make sure you check the tires with weights it’s supposed to handle after assembly.
customer_reviews.author: Tango C

customer_reviews.title: 250 lbs didn't phase it. Thats all I had to test and it was like it was empty
customer_reviews.text: I only gave it a 4 on sturdiness because all I could get in it was 250lbs of lime and fertilizer. on level ground you don't even know it has anything inside its that smooth. Going down a slope was a test and you can't lead it because all you have it that little handle so I tried letting it down the slope. Its not easy...this thing rolls so easy its had to control on a slope. overall easy to assemble 2 sockets and a screw driver might be needed.
customer_reviews.author: J. stalnaker

customer_reviews.title: I don't see the point
customer_reviews.text: I bought this based on the strength of the reviews here, and honestly I am disappointed. I guess the quality of construction is OK, and the item is basically as described. What was not clear to me was that the inside is not smooth - it has ridges making it difficult to mix something like cement. I also believe it has less utility than a traditional wheelbarrow, which could be used, for example, to dump stuff into a fire. Good luck trying that with this. I am going to keep it and let my kids use it to play with; I am going to get a steel wheelbarrow for work. No need to "fix" what isn't broken.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: 100% Better than a wheelbarrow
customer_reviews.text: This was trivial to set up with the hardware provided. Anyone who knows what a wrench looks like and how to use it will have NO trouble assembling this! I have used this to transport TONS of gravel, rock, and dirt over rough terrain and small hills. This is INFINITELY easier to use than any wheelbarrow I’ve had. It holds amazing weights and is easy to maneuver and pull even when loaded with hundreds of pounds. It’s been a lifesaver for me.
customer_reviews.author: WCR

customer_reviews.title: Handy yard cart
customer_reviews.text: This was a bit tedious to put together but worth the effort. I purchased this to replace a similar one that was over 10 years old. The new plastic is not as sturdy but certainly satisfactory for hauling lawn bags to the curb, moving large flower pots around and hauling mulch and potting soil. This has the ability to dump the contents from an up position which is very handy. Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy W.

customer_reviews.title: Some flaws but decent for the money
customer_reviews.text: The plastic basin has a lot of give to it. A wheel barrow would be more sturdy. We are using this for the beach etc. so it should be fine. It smells just like everything that is manufactured in China. I wish the wheels connected a different way, a Bobby pin seems a little cheap in my opinion. Considering similar carts go for more, this is a decent product for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan C

customer_reviews.title: Great little garden wagon
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to assemble. A socket set with either 1/2 inch or 13 mm sockets would be helpful, a wide flat bladed screwdriver, and some adjustable wrenches or a channel lock plier are all you need. Bolts were a little on the long side so deeper sockets work best. Directions were very good. Product gets minus one star because it’s made in China and took almost three weeks for delivery.
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: Rolls,steers and dumps without a struggle...
customer_reviews.text: I'm satisfied with this medium duty cart.Nice design and construction-Rolls,steers and dumps easily;I hope the plastic tub is a type that is durable over time-and it's smaller than I pictured(It won't contain a mountain of twigs and brush or leaves).But I have used it with topsoil,wet leaves,weeds,lawn clippings and also stacked as much cordwood on as I could(without it tipping over).I'd say it will be nice to have for gravel,sand ,mulch,etc....So far,So good :) The Gorilla Cart name invokes an image in my mind where the CoReps would throw a few of these carts in with actual Silverback Gorillas to see what happens :)
customer_reviews.author: jonathan p.

customer_reviews.title: Breaks easily under gentle care.
customer_reviews.text: HORRIBLE wagon. We bought a replacement when the first one broke and the second one broke too! We used them LIGHTLY and they just don’t last. Not tough, not even slightly durable. I would imagine the good reviews are not written by people who have had the wagon and used it for more than a couple weeks. Such a disappointment and huge expense lost on 2 of these.
customer_reviews.author: Rie

customer_reviews.title: For price I suppose worth it they decide more valuable go the other way running.
customer_reviews.text: It's what you expect for the price but marginally smaller than pictures allude to. It's Amazon vendors, you see you can haul a piano and it only fits a trumpet. Dimensions don't mean SH!T in advertising. Dump feature reason for buying and size let me down. If bed doesn't twist & contort in occasionally direct sunlight I guess I'm satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice little cart, light weight and sturdy. In fact the sturdiness was tested on its way to my home. The box arrived pretty beat up and I was quite concerned upon opening. The plastic bed of the wagon has really taken some shipping abuse but has no cracks or deformities on it. It does show the impacts it received as these are a lighter color. I considered returning the item but decided to keep it. With that being said it will obviously will take any abuse I can give it.
customer_reviews.author: Judy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Maneuverability
customer_reviews.text: I loaded lots of mulch in it from front yard to backyard. On my way there was a tight spot but I could easily maneuver it. I must have made 20+ rounds without a problem. It is sturdy but the plastic bends a little when I put heavier wood logs. After taking those out it was fine. Maybe it is a desired feature. I will definitely recommend this to others.
customer_reviews.author: aj

customer_reviews.title: Well works!
customer_reviews.text: Only complaint is the cheap nuts and bolts. I'm a retired Machinist, so know of what I speak. The bolt square into metal to hold, but the plastic gives up to easy. Best a power socket driver the Lock Nut (NyLoks), BIG Phillips to hold the bolt into the square in the plastic. I got every one but one to tighten. Yep, they can be a PITA. Easy is to toss it and use a regular Hex Head 5/16 bolt, nut, washer and lock washer.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Q

customer_reviews.title: Awesome cart but make sure you double check the size
customer_reviews.text: This cart is sturdy and well made. That being said, it's also a little smaller than I was anticipating. It's my fault for not being 100% sure about the dimensions. We have a horse and a donkey and it's the perfect size for bringing out hay and other things around the farm. I recommend, just make sure you're comfortable with the size before purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: PacNW Dog Lover

customer_reviews.title: Great cart for yard work.
customer_reviews.text: Great review. Bought this for my grandma who was wanting something to pull around the yard with her “yard supplies.” She loves it. I put it together for her which was fairly easy. My only suggestion to the company would be flat free tires. While we’ve had no issues with the tires so far, I’m sure it’s a matter of time before we will.
customer_reviews.author: Eli Watts

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality hardware
customer_reviews.text: The hardware (nuts bolts etc) that were supplied with the cart were of the worst quality possible. What should have taken 15 minutes to assemble took over an hour and required the help of a second person. Nuts an bolts aren't rocket science. One would think they can supply decent quality. Given the poor quality of the hardware I am not too optimistic about teh overall product.
customer_reviews.author: whywhy

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended for Anyone
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves this cart. It is simple to put together, and he is using it for so many things around the house inside and out. He especially loves it for bringing in a load of wood for the wood stove, he has medical issues and can handle it without problems. This says a lot. The dump feature works great and is easy on his back. The wide tires are definitely a plus when wet out. Highly recommended for anyone.
customer_reviews.author: jane

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the job
customer_reviews.text: EXACTLY what I was looking for. Have large property and sometimes the truck or tractor is too big for the job, but the job is too big to move by hand. I was looking for something less substantial but for the same price, this more than fit my needs. Using to move buckets of feed, cinder blocks, pavers - perfect. Took longer to assemble than I would have thought but it was not difficult, and was very easy to figure out.
customer_reviews.author: Christiane

customer_reviews.title: An excellent buy. Easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.text: I did a far bit of review before purchasing this particular garden dump cart. It's sold with aircraft fasteners that won't vibrate loose during extended use. The fastener kit was easy to assemble to the frame and dump components. I didn't even have to consult the assembly instructions. It's a great help in moving split firewood as well as doing yard work. Thanks for asking!
customer_reviews.author: RLD Process / Documentation Consulting

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: It’s a great little lawn cart. Tires are large enough to roll over different terrain with a lot of loaded weight. Assembly instructions are easy to follow with step by step procedures and hardware needed for that step. I don’t normally do these reviews but this product deserves a good rating. I would buy again
customer_reviews.author: Edward Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Okay but not that strong
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this with the hopes that I could haul lots of mulch and dirt. I can only put 3 bags of mulch in it or the sides begin to cave and it becomes difficult to manage. A little disappointed because I was hoping to be able to haul much more with the statement that it holds 600 pounds. Don't believe that is true given my experience.
customer_reviews.author: laurajrc1961

customer_reviews.title: Great, sturdy little cart.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great cart. I couldn't use the lock washers because the cheap bolts stripped out so I held them with Vice grip pliers and drilled out the nylon and used regular lock washers but not a big deal. Wheels roll super easy and the turning radius is amazing. Seems very sturdy. If you have problems putting your cart together, I suggest eliminating soy products from your diet.
customer_reviews.author: The Viking

product_meta.title: Gorilla Carts GOR4PS Poly Garden Dump Cart with Steel Frame and 10-in. Pneumatic Tires, 600-Pound Capacity, Black
product_meta.description: Color:Black| Style:Dump CartThe newly-designed Gorilla Carts 600-lb. Capacity Poly Garden Dump Cart has an innovative, updated frame design that makes it quick and easy to assemble and put this cart to work. The cart features the patented quick-release dumping system, which allows the cart to be loaded and unloaded with ease, and the balanced 4-wheel design makes it a simple-to-use alternative to a wheelbarrow. The new frame design allows for easy assembly, while improving maneuverability and rigidity, increasing ground clearance, and giving the cart a tight turning radius. The durable poly bed is maintenance-free and easy to clean, and the 10 in. pneumatic tires are designed to handle any terrain whether you’re hauling heavy dirt, mulch, gravel, or plants. With a 600 lb. hauling capacity and padded dipped-grip handle, this cart is perfect for the casual gardener or the lawn professional. The bed dimensions measure 36-inches by 20-inches, and the cart has an overall height of 19.5-inches and weighs 32-pounds. Gorilla Carts full line of products meets the needs of the light-duty homeowner as well as the commercial-duty professional user by offering a wide variety of carts in different sizes and weight capacities. The Gorilla Carts GOR4PS Poly Garden Dump Cart comes with a 1-year limited warranty.
feature_bullets: Patented quick-release dump feature makes unloading quick and easy
New frame design reduces assembly time while offering improved maneuverability and ground clearance
Durable 38.7-inch x 20-inch rust-proof poly bed and 10-inch pneumatic tires
Padded pull handle makes it easy to pull up to 600-pounds.1-year limited warranty

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars4,434 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
